headline.main: 'IDEAL WEIGHT' FOR A LONG LIFE ADJUSTED UPWARD IN A SURVEY

docs.lead_paragraph: The ''ideal weight'' for a long life has been adjusted upward. New height and weight tables for optimum longevity made public yesterday by the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company indicate that adults can weigh more now than their counterparts did in 1959, when the last advisory was issued. The latest tables show an average increase in recommended weight of 13 pounds for short men, seven pounds for men of medium height and two pounds for tall men. The average increase for short women is 10 pounds, while it is eight pounds for women of medium height and three pounds for tall women. The new weights, though higher than in the past, are still far below the weight of most Americans.
